author: dennis w hendrickson

review: I bought this so I wouldn't have to move my Roku 3 from the living room 39" living room tv,  to the bedroom 32" tv. It streams great, but the text size and display in every navigation screen is impossible to read when laying in bed, about 16' from the screen. I've tried using the maximum enlargement on my camera phone, or a cheap pair of binoculars, but the text display on my 32" HDTV is so small and hard to read with magnification. The text on the Roku screen is fine.It's like trying to read the print on a rebate coupon anymore. I've had to photograph "legalese" on so many lables/coupons/receipts lately, I think there should be a minimum readability standard that at least equals the equivalent standard for passing a DMV vision test. This wouldn't. It functionally works great. I am a long-term and expressive proponent of Amazon, and my Prime membership. This product lacks, unless it's a setting on my TV that makes the screens too small to see.

author: Jake Sylvis

review: Being an avid chromecast user, I was a bit skeptical about the Fire TV Stick. However, after a month of use, I have found myself pleasantly surprised. Watching Netflix and Prime Instant Video on this device are great. The remote is top notch and I find myself using it much more than I expected. The only reason I'm docking this product a star is I have had some issues with the youtube app apparently crashing and/or freezing up my Fire TV Stick, which I have never had happen on my Chromecast. This is definitely a worthwhile purchase if you're looking for a streaming stick and a must-have for watching Prime Instant Video, but if you prefer controlling a streaming stick with your phone I would probably go with the chromecast.
